page.title: 17GRANGE FARM,BARTON-IN-FABIS
page.content: Owned by{Mr John Plowright}who works the farm together with his wife and a Y.O.P's boy(Youth Opportunity Scheme) The farm is situated on the south bank of the River Trent at{ {Barton-In-Fabis}and is given over to farmed grass land on which graze over 750 sheep.It is one of the rare sheep farms in this part of the Midlands. Even more rare is the new breed of sheep Mr Plowright farms.Called{ {Friesian Sheep,}they are milked in a two bay mechanical milking parlour,the milk is put in cartons,deep frozen and sent to health clinics.It is used in the treatment of illnesses such as{ {Asthma}and{Skin Diseases.} Mr Plowrights chief worry is the work of the River Trent eroding approximately 10 Metres of land every 2-3 years.
